name: piously
content:
piously adverb
(RELIGIOUSLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows that you have strong religious beliefs: I envision a church that is not just piously involved in worship on a Sunday morning. The brothers are piously Roman Catholic.
More examplesFewer examplesThey wander among us with their arms held toward heaven, singing piously.He clasped his hands and looked up piously to heaven.He urged that young people must be piously brought up.

piously adverb
(PRETENDING)
disapproving in a way that pretends to be religious or sincere: The politicians talked piously about reforming their own arrangements, but nothing has changed. When we talk so piously about sustainability, is it really right to be burning up fossil fuels to create new materials? See
pious
More examplesFewer examplesSome athletes piously make the sign of the cross on their chest and then leave the game to use drugs. Development ministers piously proclaim that they will honour their commitments.They piously lecture athletes for moral or professional failings.
